title: Hawaii Reader in Traditional Chinese Culture
subject: China -- Civilization$$QChina -- Civilization -- Sources Textbooks
Chine -- Civilisation$$QChine -- Civilisation -- Sources Manuels d'enseignement supérieur
SOCIAL SCIENCE -- Ethnic Studies -- Asian American Studies
Civilization
Kultur
China
description: The Hawai'i Reader in Traditional Chinese Culture is a collection of more than ninety primary sources--all but a few of which were translated specifically for this volume--of cultural significance from the Bronze Age to the turn of the twentieth century. They take into account virtually every aspect of traditional culture, including sources from the non-Sinitic ethnic minorities.
contributor: Goldin, Paul R., editor.$$QGoldin, Paul R.
Mair, Victor H., editor.$$QMair, Victor H.
Steinhardt, Nancy Shatzman, editor.$$QSteinhardt, Nancy Shatzman
contents: Frontmatter -- Contents -- Contributors -- Historical chronology -- Preface -- Terms and Abbreviations -- A Note on the Transcription and Translation of the Titles of Chinese Texts -- Acknowledgments -- Introduction:A Constantly Shifting Mosaic of Peoples and Cultures -- 1. Shang Dynasty Oracle-Bone Inscriptions / Mattos, Gilbert I. -- 2. Shang and Zhou Ritual Bronze Inscriptions / Mattos, Gilbert I. -- 3. Astronomy in Early Chinese Sources / Pankenier, David -- 4. Milfoil-Divination / Goldin, Paul R. -- 5. Heaven's Mandate / Goldin, Paul R. -- 6. The Odes / Goldin, Paul R. -- 7. Confucius and the Birth of Chinese Philosophy / Goldin, Paul R. -- 8. The World of the Zuozhuan / Goldin, Paul R. -- 12. The Tradition of the Daode jing / Goldin, Paul R. / Mair, Victor H. -- 13. Zhuang Zi / Goldin, Paul R. / Mair, Victor H. -- 14. The Paradoxes of Hui Shi and Others / Goldin, Paul R. -- 15. The Lyrics of Chu and the Aesthetic of Shamanism / Goldin, Paul R. -- 16. Filial Piety / Goldin, Paul R. -- 17. The Methods of War of Sun Wu and Sun Bin / Goldin, Paul R. -- 18. Xun Zi and the Confucian Way / Goldin, Paul R. -- 19. Early Discussions of Music and Literature / Goldin, Paul R. / Mair, Victor H. -- 20. Vestments of Mourning / Goldin, Paul R. -- 21. Han Fei Zi and His Antecedents / Goldin, Paul R. -- 22. Xie Lingyun, Preface to Record of Excursions to Famous Mountains / Berkowitz, Alan -- 41. Fan Ye, Preface to "Accounts of Disengaged Persons" / Berkowitz, Alan -- 42. Buddhism and Language in Early-Medieval China / Boucher, Daniel -- 43. Buddhism and Indigenous Chinese Culture / Mather, Richard -- 44. Early-Medieval Stories of Filial Piety / Knapp, Keith -- 45. The Elevation of Belles Lettres / Cai, Zong-Qi -- 46. Legends of The Original Vow of the Bodhisattva of the Earth Sanctuary / Mark, Lindy Li -- 47. Selections from the Platform Sutra of the Sixth Patriarch / Foster, Robert -- 48. Sima Guang, "The Battle of Mang Mountain" / Graff, David A. -- 49. Han Yu, "A Memorial on the Relic of the Buddha" / Xiong, Victor Cunrui -- 53. Han Yu, "The Original Way" / Foster, Robert -- 54. The First Recorded Cinderella Story / Mair, Victor H. -- 55. Late-Tang Foreign Relations: The Uyghur Crisis / Drompp, Michael R. -- 56. Political and Economic Problems concerning Buddhism / Liu, Xinru / Mair, Victor H. -- 57. Zhang Jiucheng's Explanation of Zhang Zai's "Western Inscription" / Foster, Robert -- 64. Zhu Xi, Introduction to the Redacted Centrality and Commonality / Foster, Robert -- 65. Dragons, Tigers, and Elixirs: Alchemy in Medieval China / Skar, Lowell -- 66. The Autobiographical Sermon of Zuqin / Wu, Pei-Yi -- 67. Yuan Mei, Champion of Individual Taste / Mair, Denis -- 87. Gesar of Ling / Kornman, Robin -- 88. To Hell and Back: A Nineteenth-century Fable / Sutton, Donald S. -- 89. Biographies of Exemplary Women / Mann, Susan L. -- 90. Kang Youwei, "An Investigation into the Reforms of Confucius" / Mair, Victor H. / Foster, Robert -- 91. Lu Xun, An Outsider's Chats about Written Language / Mair, Victor H. -- 92.
